IMPORT.description: OMT files within a module can import objects from each other directly. But sometimes you want to import objects from other modules.

IMPORT_ITEM.description: A single item in an import block

PREFIXES.description: A dictionary with prefixes that will be used to resolve short iris in the associated document.

PREFIXES_ITEM.description: A single item in a prefixes block

QUERIES.description: An ODT script with one or more DEFINE QUERY statements to define reusable queries that can be used within the associated document.

QUERIES_ITEM.description: A single item in a queries block

COMMANDS.description: An ODT script with one or more DEFINE COMMAND statements to define reusable commands that can be used within the associated document.

COMMANDS_ITEM_SIMPLE.description: A simple command for a commands block

COMMANDS_ITEM_BLOCK.description: A multi-statement command for a commands block

MODEL.description: A dictionary of object to use in or export from this document.

GRAPHS.description: Specifies which named graphs should be available for the ODT queries in this module.

GRAPHS_ITEM.description: A single item in a graphs block.

MENU.description: A dictionary of menu items that should be presented to the end user.

ACTION.description: ODT based piece of business logic that can be invoked by the user interface.

ACTIVITY.description: An OMT Activity is a interactive piece of business logic that can be executed by an end user.

BINDINGS.description: A Binding is the bridge between the javascript user interface layer and an OMT component.

ON_CHANGE.description: An ODT script that gets executed each time the ODT variable for this binding returns a different value.

COMPONENT.description: An OMT Component is an interactive piece of business logic that can be executed by an end user.

ONTOLOGY.description: An Ontology describes and restricts the structure of data.

PROCEDURE.description: An OMT Procedure is a piece of business logic that can be executed at will, for example from the command line or in response to some external event.
